data.what_is:
OutboundEngine helps businesses grow by making online marketing simple and easy for everyone.

We create beautiful, high-impact marketing campaigns, deliver them automatically and track engagement to show who's ready to have a conversation. Our platform strengthens relationships with customers, partners and prospects to uncover more opportunities with less work.

initial_reviews.review_title: Outbound Engine Marketing is Not Worth the Money
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
When I first signed up, I had a dedicated account manager who was great! We spoke every month, she asked what was working and what wasn't. She went through my marketing thoroughly, made suggestions and then before we got off the call, she made sure to calendar our next meeting.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
Once they revamped their business model and got rid of the dedicated account managers it was impossible to connect with anyone. You can only go through "success@outboundengine.com" and never would I receive any emails or phone calls as requested. I finally got a hold of someone in billing after several months of trying and that person agreed to reduce my monthly charge. I still had no contact of anyone ever reaching out to see how I was liking the product. I wasn't. Then I've been trying to cancel for several months and no one calls or emails back. They are just taking the money and running with it. Do not sign up for this company. They will take your money and do the bare minimum. There are months that my FB was not linked and they didn't care and didn't do anything about it except to continue charging me monthly dues.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
Did not help. Was not a benefit. At various points, LinkedIn and/or Facebook will disconnect from Outbound. Other than a spam email notifying the user that it's been disconnected, they do nothing to help you or notify you that it's been disconnected, therefore the money you are paying them to promote on those pages is wasted because it's not connected.
This so called service is a huge waste of money.

initial_reviews.review_title: Can be annoying to returning clients, poor business practices
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
Engagement with visitors to the website and email of any convo afterward

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
1- As a real estate business, clients often return to look at properties. Our best clients were annoyed at having to click off the pop-up every visit.
2- When we canceled, we thought it was over.  After months (20) of continued billing, our bookkeeper asked if this was still active. No, it was not. And we should not have been billed.  When calling in to double-check our cancellation, we were told that after you "speak with a Solutions Specialist, who will confirm the cancellation or non-renewal via email."  The account will be closed... We did not get an email and did not know we needed to look for one. They can see the service was discontinued and will not refund the overbilling. It is theft and poor business practice.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
It was of little benefit.  Very few engagements were forwarded to us. The annoyance outweighed the benefit.

initial_reviews.review_title: Outrageously expensive, customer service is non existent
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
Newsletters sent on your behalf. Nothing else positive

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
Everything else. If you want to spend $600 a month to have newsletters sent and nothing else, this product is for you! when i started, I had an account executive that was super helpful and called me every month to make sure I was utilizing the product and understood all the features. apparently sometime ago, they were acquired by ElM Street Technologies and everything about them has sucked ever since. And i mean EVERYTHING! They told noone about the sale, then raised their price $70 per month without notifying their customers, got rid of their client success managers (also without telling the customer) and don't actually offer the product at the price that they advertize online.

Good luck trying to get ANYONE to call you back for any reason! I have tried emailing, calling, etc. I did finally receive a phone call back 8 days after my request, but it was from an anonymous # so i didn't answer. Called right back and no one answers the phone. Called a different line and the girl said she has no idea why they didn't notify us of the change of ownership, cost increase and service and product decrease. She said i am not eligible for the prices online. those are only available for new clients, but there is no fine print stating that on the website. Since she obvously couldn't help me, i asked for a supervisor. She said there is no one available and someone will call me back whenever they have time. I asked if that would be less than 8 days which is how long the last all took and she, of course, didn't know.

DO NOT sign up for this company!!! They are beyond horrible and it's rediculously expensive and they make it impossible to cancel! Please don't get burnded like i did. I think they offered a decent product at one point but since aquired by ELM STREET TECHNOLOGY they absolutely suck!

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
None now.

initial_reviews.review_title: Terrible Content, Tons of Click-bate, Get ready for your email to hit every spam filter
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
I love the idea and the promises that the sales team made to me. Increase email open by 2x, increase click-through by 50%.  We actually saw a decline in both metrics.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
False advertising. Terrible content that wasn't applicable to my market, region, or hemisphere. All the lousy click bate. It actually became an embarrassment for me and my brand. They also don't tell you that they will filter out large swaths of your email contacts. If you have anyone with a Yahoo! email account, they are out. They have this logic to reduce bounce and spam, which was interesting because all my work email does now since using them is go into everyone's spam folder. So lame. So they failed on all accounts and all promises, you would think they would let you cancel, NOPE! you have to keep paying. So I asked them to at least stop sending emails out on my behalf, they agreed, and kept sending the terrible emails.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
The promise is that they would take the wheel at touching my sphere of influence and cultivate interest and monitor activity so people would bubble up to the top and you could focus on them. Their software platform did do that so it was pretty cool the way it worked. The content they used was just terrible so it didn't matter. Trying to get your own original content into the newsletter was less than easy or optimized.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!

I would avoid this company at all costs unless you enjoy giving away your money.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
There was nothing helpful about the product or team. They have the worst customer service in the industry. During my onboarding call, it was suggested that I can create my own content. I thought at that point, what am I really paying for here?!

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
I wish I would have read some of these negative reviews before signing up with this company. I went through my sales call with one of the account executives, and it was explained that Outbound Engine would have content for my business partners. The main reason I decided to proceed with Outbound Engine was so that I could engage my business partners. Unfortunately, that was not the case. I was also told that Outbound Engine would register my business on 72 different directories, during my onboarding call, it was explained that I would have to complete the directory information on my own for directories that I had already signed up for. Why would the salesperson say that they would register me on these directories, and make sure that my existing information was correct on existing directories if that was not the case.  It seemed too good to be true because it was. I tried to reach out to their customer success team and was promised a call on Monday, 5/16/22, no one reached out. I called back on Thursday to follow up, and received a return call, the representative said that I signed a contract and tried to retain my business for a lower price. I wanted to cancel my services with Outbound Engine. I never used their platform and never got through my onboarding call because of all the discrepancies. Shame on them for handling the situation the way that they did. Where's the customer service that you provided me during your sales call? This company is a scam, and I would not recommend their services to anyone.

Recommendations to others considering OutboundEngine:
Have a clear understanding of what's included with the Outbound Engine technology.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
Outbound Engine could not help me with my business because they do not offer any marketing to my business partners as explained during my sales call. I would also like to point out that they do not set you up on the directories that you have credentials for.

all_reviews.review_title: Outbound Engine Marketing is Not Worth the Money
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
When I first signed up, I had a dedicated account manager who was great! We spoke every month, she asked what was working and what wasn't. She went through my marketing thoroughly, made suggestions and then before we got off the call, she made sure to calendar our next meeting.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
Once they revamped their business model and got rid of the dedicated account managers it was impossible to connect with anyone. You can only go through "success@outboundengine.com" and never would I receive any emails or phone calls as requested. I finally got a hold of someone in billing after several months of trying and that person agreed to reduce my monthly charge. I still had no contact of anyone ever reaching out to see how I was liking the product. I wasn't. Then I've been trying to cancel for several months and no one calls or emails back. They are just taking the money and running with it. Do not sign up for this company. They will take your money and do the bare minimum. There are months that my FB was not linked and they didn't care and didn't do anything about it except to continue charging me monthly dues.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
Did not help. Was not a benefit. At various points, LinkedIn and/or Facebook will disconnect from Outbound. Other than a spam email notifying the user that it's been disconnected, they do nothing to help you or notify you that it's been disconnected, therefore the money you are paying them to promote on those pages is wasted because it's not connected.
This so called service is a huge waste of money.

all_reviews.review_title: Can be annoying to returning clients, poor business practices
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
Engagement with visitors to the website and email of any convo afterward

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
1- As a real estate business, clients often return to look at properties. Our best clients were annoyed at having to click off the pop-up every visit.
2- When we canceled, we thought it was over.  After months (20) of continued billing, our bookkeeper asked if this was still active. No, it was not. And we should not have been billed.  When calling in to double-check our cancellation, we were told that after you "speak with a Solutions Specialist, who will confirm the cancellation or non-renewal via email."  The account will be closed... We did not get an email and did not know we needed to look for one. They can see the service was discontinued and will not refund the overbilling. It is theft and poor business practice.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
It was of little benefit.  Very few engagements were forwarded to us. The annoyance outweighed the benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: Outrageously expensive, customer service is non existent
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
Newsletters sent on your behalf. Nothing else positive

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
Everything else. If you want to spend $600 a month to have newsletters sent and nothing else, this product is for you! when i started, I had an account executive that was super helpful and called me every month to make sure I was utilizing the product and understood all the features. apparently sometime ago, they were acquired by ElM Street Technologies and everything about them has sucked ever since. And i mean EVERYTHING! They told noone about the sale, then raised their price $70 per month without notifying their customers, got rid of their client success managers (also without telling the customer) and don't actually offer the product at the price that they advertize online.

Good luck trying to get ANYONE to call you back for any reason! I have tried emailing, calling, etc. I did finally receive a phone call back 8 days after my request, but it was from an anonymous # so i didn't answer. Called right back and no one answers the phone. Called a different line and the girl said she has no idea why they didn't notify us of the change of ownership, cost increase and service and product decrease. She said i am not eligible for the prices online. those are only available for new clients, but there is no fine print stating that on the website. Since she obvously couldn't help me, i asked for a supervisor. She said there is no one available and someone will call me back whenever they have time. I asked if that would be less than 8 days which is how long the last all took and she, of course, didn't know.

DO NOT sign up for this company!!! They are beyond horrible and it's rediculously expensive and they make it impossible to cancel! Please don't get burnded like i did. I think they offered a decent product at one point but since aquired by ELM STREET TECHNOLOGY they absolutely suck!

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
None now.

all_reviews.review_title: Terrible Content, Tons of Click-bate, Get ready for your email to hit every spam filter
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
I love the idea and the promises that the sales team made to me. Increase email open by 2x, increase click-through by 50%.  We actually saw a decline in both metrics.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
False advertising. Terrible content that wasn't applicable to my market, region, or hemisphere. All the lousy click bate. It actually became an embarrassment for me and my brand. They also don't tell you that they will filter out large swaths of your email contacts. If you have anyone with a Yahoo! email account, they are out. They have this logic to reduce bounce and spam, which was interesting because all my work email does now since using them is go into everyone's spam folder. So lame. So they failed on all accounts and all promises, you would think they would let you cancel, NOPE! you have to keep paying. So I asked them to at least stop sending emails out on my behalf, they agreed, and kept sending the terrible emails.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
The promise is that they would take the wheel at touching my sphere of influence and cultivate interest and monitor activity so people would bubble up to the top and you could focus on them. Their software platform did do that so it was pretty cool the way it worked. The content they used was just terrible so it didn't matter. Trying to get your own original content into the newsletter was less than easy or optimized.

I wanted to be able to reach out to past clients regarding recurring shoots and potential jobs, and I wanted some way to let them know what I was up to so I was top of mind whenever they needed to book a job. OutboundEngine streamlines this outreach process, and their content is professional and thorough without looking too sales-y. It has addressed the disorganization issue while bringing in new leads and initiating recurring jobs with past clients.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
OutboundEngine is an expensive service, which was hard to justify at first since I am just getting my business off the ground.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am solving the aforementioned issue of disorganization with client contacts. I want to be able to reach out to previous clients regarding job needs, and wanted a way to stay top of mind that was enjoyable for them without seeming like a sales pitch. I have seen a good return on investment with OutboundEngine and I have gotten back in touch with some previous clients!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
I'm not the best at remembering to send stay in touch with past clients. I get distracted! Outbound Engine takes that task of my 'to-do" list by sending out timely and informative emails and social media posts. They also alert me when past buyers and sellers read my emails and social media posts so that I can contact them and start a conversation. It helps me stay top-of-mind with my client base without me spending hours writing and refining content. My only gripe (and this is so minor!) is that when I have a conference call scheduled, if I'm on the phone and can't answer their call, I'm done for that month! There are no second chances! LOL! It was totally my fault and I'm certainly not the only call they have to make so I've learned to respect their time and make sure I'm available when they call. The calls are scheduled over a month in advance so it really isn't a problem. I just have to make sure I'm ready. Their communication really is excellent though. I've used other platforms where I signed up and didn't hear from them again after the initial installation. OE really keeps my in the loop. I've been very pleased with their product!~

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
As I said above, I wish I had a little bit of wiggle room on the conference calls. If I have one scheduled at 8:30 am and I can't get off the phone until 8:33, I wish they'd call me back maybe once to see if I'm off the phone. There are some phone calls that I have to take in order to provide quality service to my clients and I hate to ignore calls because they might run into my OE time. It's a minor gripe but one I've run into.

Recommendations to others considering OutboundEngine:
It definitely saves me time with social media marketing. I don't have to worry about it anymore.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm still working to see how many people actually open and read my emails and social media content. Sometimes, it's enough to just keep my name in front of my clients. I do have people mention that they've seen my posts so they are working. I'd like to be able to personalize my emails just a little more but that may not be possible.

all_reviews.review_title: Horrific Customer Service and Irrelevant Content
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OutboundEngine?
There is nothing positive I would have to say about Outbound Engine.

What do you dislike about OutboundEngine?
The content that this company produces could be generated by a fifth grader in under an hour.  There is no insight, no creativity, and minimal effort put forth at best.  If you want to send your clients a 3-5 point list of DIY projects that are likely irrelevant or lacking insight, this might work for you.  If you care about your brand and want your marketing dollars to generate leads, or at least some positive customer feedback, this is not the company for you.  They sent out a piece to my Colorado customers in October with ideas how to spruce up your backyard.  October in Colorado means cleaning up the leaves and preparing for snow, not building pergolas.  The campaigns I sent out had an open rate of 50-60% higher than the mickey-mouse marketing they did.

Recommendations to others considering OutboundEngine:
If your brand matters to you and you don't want your customers making fun of the stupid content that you send them, find another vendor.

What problems is OutboundEngine solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have not received one bit of value for the $1,000 I spent on these clowns.
